dublin_core.dcvalue: A brief introduction is given to the definitions and history of surgical robotics The capabilities and merits of surgical robots are then contrasted with the related field of computer assisted surgery A classification is then given of the various types of robot system currently being investigated internationally together with a number of examples of different applications in both soft tissue and orthopaedic surgery The paper finishes with a discussion of the main difficulties facing robotic surgery and a prediction of future progress
Proceedings of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers. Part H, Journal of engineering in medicine
A review of robotics in surgery.
